quote: LightLightThe visible reminder of Invisible Light.
author: T.S. Eliot

quote: Light tomorrow with today!
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote: To light a candle is to cast a shadow...
author: Ursula K. Le Guin,  A Wizard of Earthsea

quote: We are not our own light.
author: Nicolas Malebranche

quote: There are darknesses in life and there are lights, and you are one of the lights, the light of all lights.
author: Bram Stoker,  Dracula

quote: Light in comparison with darkness is a void.
author: Vladimir Nabokov

quote: The brightest light casts the darkest shadow.
author: Jess C. Scott,  The Darker Side of Life

quote: I will love the light for it shows me the way, yet I will endure the darkness because it shows me the stars.
author: Og Mandino

quote: Who would bring light must endure burning.
author: David Zindell,  The Wild

quote: Living is not enough; we must live an illuminated life.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Light is more important than the lantern,The poem more important than the notebook
author: Nizar Qabbani

quote: We must pass through the darkness, to reach the light.
author: Albert Pike

quote: Darkness cannot survive in light, but a light can shine in the dark!
author: Odille Rault,  Beyond the Magic Pill: A Collection of the Insights of Illusions

quote: How dare you say it's nothing to me?Baby, you're the only light I ever saw.
author: John Mayer,  Continuum: Music by John Mayer

quote: May it be a light to you in dark places, when all other lights go out.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien,  The Fellowship of the Ring

quote: There are two ways of spreading light: to be the candle or the mirror that receives it.
author: Edith Wharton

quote: The path of light is the quest for knowledge.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita,  Pearls of Wisdom: Great mind

quote: Give light and people will find the way.
author: Ella Baker

quote: Breathe light into your body - breathe light into your Heart - Breathe light into your mind - Breathe and OPEN! Breathe and remember that you are all LIGHT - Infinite LIGHT -Blessed LIGHT- open your heart and SHINE ON!
author: Angie karan

quote: Dive again and again into the river of uncertainty. Create in the dark, only then can you recognize the light.
author: Jyrki Vainonen

quote: There are two ways of spreading light: to be the candle or the mirror that reflects it.
author: Edith Wharton

quote: Only a blind man can easily define what light is. When you do not know, you are bold. Ignorance is always bold; knowledge hesitates. And the more you know, the more you feel that the ground underneath is dissolving. The more you know, the more you feel how ignorant you are.
author: Osho,  The Book of Secrets

quote: Light is meaningful only in relation to darkness, and truth presupposes error. It is these mingled opposites which people our life, which make it pungent, intoxicating. We only exist in terms of this conflict, in the zone where black and white clash.
author: Louis Aragon

quote: He who does not see the light in others does not see the light in himself.
author: Doreen DeVore

quote: Light makes photography. Embrace light. Admire it. Love it. But above all, know light. Know it for all you are worth, and you will know the key to photography.
author: George Eastman

quote: Doubt everything. Find your own light.
author: Gautama Buddha

quote: As we all know, blinking lights means science.
author: Joss Whedon

quote: One day, your light will silence the darkness, and you will be surrounded by the beauty within.
author: A.D. Posey

quote: Remember that light becomes evident in darkness. We do not create light by avoiding those who are captives of darkness; but we become light by illuminating the night. Remember that always.
author: C. JoyBell C.

quote: When darkness is at its darkest, a star shines the brightest.
author: Louise Philippe

quote: Whether in the intellectual pursuits of science or in the mystical pursuits of the spirit, the light beckons ahead, and the purpose surging in our nature responds.
author: Arthur Stanley Eddington,  The Nature of the Physical World

quote: In the dark I rest,unready for the light which dawnsday after day,eager to be shared.Black silk, shelter me.I needmore of the night before I openeyes and heartto illumination. I must stillgrow in the dark like a rootnot ready, not ready at all.
author: Denise Levertov

quote: Give light, and the darkness will disappear of itself.
author: Desiderius Erasmus

quote: For darkness restores what light cannot repair.
author: Joseph Brodsky

quote: We move between two darknesses.
author: E.M. Forster,  Aspects of the Novel

quote: Enlightenment is light.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Even a single lamp dispels the deepest darkness.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: In the darkness, two shadows, reaching through the hopeless, heavy dusk. Their hands meet, and light spills in a flood like a hundred golden urns pouring out of the sun.
author: Madeline Miller,  The Song of Achilles

quote: To send light into the darkness of men's hearts - such is the duty of the artist.
author: Robert Schumann

quote: Prophesies are dark and don’t need a flashlight to illuminate. I’m a bring my own lighthouse kind of lover.
author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

quote: Don’t Let the Dead Fish Fool You [10w] Even the eyes of a dead fish can reflect light.
author: Beryl Dov

quote: I see black light (his last words)
author: Victor Hugo

quote: When you anxiously await to emerge from deep darkness, you will realize the beauty of light.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Proper lighting is everything, Julianna.
author: Wendelin Van Draanen,  Flipped

quote: You know, I think that only if one feels immensely important can one feel truly light.
author: Ayn Rand,  Atlas Shrugged

quote: As the light begins to intensify, so does my misery, and I wonder how it is possible to hurt so much when nothing is wrong.
author: Tabitha Suzuma,  Forbidden

quote: Glow in the Dark "You've led me from stark nightwith a love that glows in the dark.
author: Beryl Dov

quote: The artist vocation is to send light into the human heart.
author: George Sand

quote: Sometimes our light goes out, but is blown again into instant flame by an encounter with another human being.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: The presence of a noble nature, generous in its wishes, ardent in its charity, changes the lights for us: we begin to see things again in their larger, quieter masses, and to believe that we too can be seen and judged in the wholeness of our character.
author: George Eliot,  Middlemarch
